message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We conducted a regression analysis using data from the World Bank Enterprise Survey and the International Finance Corporation (IFC) on the determinants of access to finance for small and medium enterprises (SMEs).", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "International Finance Corporation (IFC)"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "This study examines the relationship between agricultural exports and economic growth in Sub-Saharan African countries, using panel data from the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) and the World Bank.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO)", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We use two datasets: the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to investigate the determinants of child malnutrition in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "To analyze the impact of air pollution on health outcomes, we used a combination of satellite data from the Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service and health records from the National Health Service in the United Kingdom.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service", "National Health Service"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes the effectiveness of public-private partnerships (PPPs) in infrastructure development based on data from the Infrastructure Projects Facility Database and the Private Participation in Infrastructure Database.", "dataset": ["Infrastructure Projects Facility Database", "Private Participation in Infrastructure Database"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "To understand the relationship between gender and labor market participation, we use data from the World Bank's STEP and LSMS surveys conducted in various African countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's STEP survey", "LSMS surveys"], "topic": ["Gender", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the International Assessment of Adult Competencies (PIAAC) and PISA to investigate gender differences in STEM education across countries with different income levels.", "dataset": ["International Assessment of Adult Competencies (PIAAC)", "PISA"], "topic": ["Education", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the impact of natural disasters on poverty reduction using a combination of data from the World Bank's Poverty and Equity Database and the United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR) disaster database.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Poverty and Equity Database", "United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR) disaster database"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "This study explores the relationship between renewable energy policies and competitiveness using data from the Global Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency Policies and Measures database and the International Trade Centre's Export Potential Map.", "dataset": ["Global Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency Policies and Measures database", "International Trade Centre's Export Potential Map"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the World Health Organization's (WHO) Global Health Expenditure Database and the UN Statistical Division's Millennium Development Goals Indicators to analyze the relationship between health spending and progress towards achieving the Millennium Development Goals.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization's (WHO) Global Health Expenditure Database", "UN Statistical Division's Millennium Development Goals Indicators"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
